example.description: Starts the specified instances using their instance ids.

Retrieves the set of EC2 instances that have a 'Name' tag ending with 'DEV' and starts them. In this example the output from Get-EC2Instance is a collection of zero of more Reservation objects, each containing a collection of Instances. The Instance objects in the Instances collection are piped to Start-EC2Instance.

This example shows how to retrieve the set of instances that are currently stopped and start them when using PowerShell v3. In this example the output from Get-EC2Instance is a collection of zero of more Reservation objects, each containing a collection of Instances. The Instance objects in the Instances collection are piped to Start-EC2Instance.

example.code: PS C:\>(Get-EC2Instance -Filter @( @{ Name="instance-state-name"; Value="stopped"}, ` @{ Name="availability-zone"; Value="us-west-2a" } )).Instances ` | Start-EC2Instance
example.description: This example shows how to retrieve the set of instances in availability zone us-west-2a that are currently stopped and start them when using PowerShell v3. In this example the output from Get-EC2Instance is a collection of zero of more Reservation objects, each containing a collection of Instances. The Instance objects in the Instances collection are piped to Start-EC2Instance.

example.code:
PS C:\>$filter1 = New-Object Amazon.EC2.Model.Filter PS C:\>$filter1.Name = "instance-state-name" PS C:\>$filter1.Value = "stopped"
PS C:\>$filter2 = New-Object Amazon.EC2.Model.Filter PS C:\>$filter2.Name = "availability-zone" PS C:\>$filter2.Value = "us-west-2a"
PS C:\>(Get-EC2Instance -Filter @( $filter1, $filter2 )).Instances | Start-EC2Instance
